summary:
Crosby, Stills & Nash (CSN) was a popular folk-rock band formed in 1968 by American musicians David Crosby and Stephen Stills, and English musician Graham Nash. They were known for their beautiful singing harmonies. When Canadian singer-songwriter Neil Young joined, they became Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young (CSNY).

Their first album, *Crosby, Stills & Nash*, had big hits like "Suite: Judy Blue Eyes." With Young, they made the top-selling album *Déjà Vu* with songs like "Woodstock." They played at the famous Woodstock festival. The group had ups and downs but made many albums and were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
title: Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young
